definition: mirror (as a metaphor for sth beautiful, bright and flat -- such as a lake -- or sth that provides clarity and insight)
Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods

sentences.english: Rinpoche also stressed the importance of carrying the mirror-mind into the dream and deep sleep states.

sentences.english: We all have a clear idea that AIDS is fatal, and there is no cure at all.

sentences.english: Chen Mingjing, a flamboyant Sichuanese entrepreneur who conceived of and funded the park, said he had always wanted to contribute to society.

sentences.english: The Erhai Lake looks like a mirror dotted with floating boats on its rippling surface.
